solution_line_template: On Monday, Mr Castiel ate {monday_fraction}*{initial_sausages} = <<{monday_fraction}*{initial_sausages}={sausages_eaten_monday}>>{sausages_eaten_monday} sausages.

The remaining number of sausages after he ate {sausages_eaten_monday} on Monday is {initial_sausages}-{sausages_eaten_monday} = <<{initial_sausages}-{sausages_eaten_monday}={remaining_after_monday}>>{remaining_after_monday}

On Tuesday, he ate half of the remaining sausages, a total of {remaining_after_monday}/{tuesday_divisor} = <<{remaining_after_monday}/{tuesday_divisor}={sausages_eaten_tuesday}>>{sausages_eaten_tuesday}.

The remaining number of sausages that he saved for Friday after eating {sausages_eaten_tuesday} on Tuesday is {remaining_after_monday}-{sausages_eaten_tuesday} = <<{remaining_after_monday}-{sausages_eaten_tuesday}={remaining_for_friday}>>{remaining_for_friday}.
On Friday, Mr Castiel ate {friday_fraction}*{remaining_for_friday} = <<{friday_fraction}*{remaining_for_friday}={sausages_eaten_friday}>>{sausages_eaten_friday} of the sausages he had kept.

The remaining number of sausages after he ate {sausages_eaten_friday} on Friday is {remaining_for_friday}-{sausages_eaten_friday} = <<{remaining_for_friday}-{sausages_eaten_friday}={final_remaining_sausages}>>{final_remaining_sausages}
